newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Gunmen kill lawyer probing death squads in Brazil.
newsitem.headline: Gunmen kill lawyer probing death squads in Brazil.

text.p: A human rights lawyer who was investigating a series of murders by a suspected death squad in northeastern Brazil was shot to death by unknown gunmen, officials said on Monday.
Gilson Nogueira, 34, was killed by machine-gun fire as he left his home in the city of Natal, Rio Grande do Norte state, on Sunday, a police spokesman said.

Amnesty International condemned the killing and said he and colleagues had received repeated death threats connected with their investigations into a suspected death squad in Natal known as the Golden Boys.

"The Brazilian human rights movement has lost a courageous and committed activist," Amnesty said in a statement. "The federal government now has the responsibility to ensure that Gilson Nogueira's death does not result in the impunity that he fought against."
Justice Minister ordered federal police officers be sent to Natal to take part in the investigations, a ministry spokesman said.
"This is a local crime which should be dealt with by local police but given that a human rights activist is involved, federal police will investigate," he said.

The spokesman for Rio Grande do Norte police said three to six gunmen were believed to have taken part in the killing and police were trying to trace a vehicle the gang used for a getaway and then set on fire.
"We have no idea who was responsible," he said.

Gilson had worked since May last year with a special commission set up by the Rio Grande do Norte state attorney to look into possible connections between the death squad and local authorities, Amnesty said.
